intro: Campsiandra comosa var. surinamensis, commonly known as the Surinamese star senna, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant features compound leaves with small, serrated leaflets and produces yellow-orange flowers that attract pollinators. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its ornamental value and ecological role make it a notable species in botanical studies.
